coreKernel.description: Foundational principles that govern all development activities

eightPrinciples.name: NASA-Style Rigour
eightPrinciples.axiom: Exhaustive, systematic, evidence-based validation where every claim is verifiable and reproducible
eightPrinciples.test: Can another qualified person reach the identical conclusion?

eightPrinciples.name: Audit Before Build
eightPrinciples.axiom: Validation must precede construction. Building upon unvalidated foundations propagates defects exponentially

eightPrinciples.name: Zero Drift Policy
eightPrinciples.axiom: Specifications and implementation shall remain synchronized at all times
eightPrinciples.test: Does the documentation accurately describe what the code does right now?

eightPrinciples.name: Living Documentation
eightPrinciples.axiom: Documentation is maintained contemporaneously, not retrospectively
eightPrinciples.test: Can a qualified engineer understand the complete system from documentation alone?

eightPrinciples.name: Full Bidirectional Traceability
eightPrinciples.axiom: Every line of code traces to a requirement; every requirement traces to implementation and verification

eightPrinciples.name: Evidence-Based Validation
eightPrinciples.axiom: Assertions without evidence are invalid. Every compliance claim requires verifiable proof
eightPrinciples.rule: If you cannot point to the exact location, you have not verified it

eightPrinciples.name: Single Source of Truth
eightPrinciples.axiom: For any category of information, exactly one authoritative source exists
eightPrinciples.test: If this information changes, how many places must be updated? Answer must be ONE

eightPrinciples.name: Defensive Documentation
eightPrinciples.axiom: Documentation anticipates failure modes and explicitly addresses edge cases

fiveImmutableLaws.name: Meaning Precedes Implementation
requirements: Every function has defined purpose before implementation

verificationDoctrine.foundationalTruth: Testing is not a phase. It is a constant companion to every action.

tenLayers.name: Functional
tenLayers.question: Does the feature work as specified?

tenLayers.name: Regression
tenLayers.question: Did new code break old functionality?

tenLayers.name: Security
tenLayers.question: Is the system secure against threats?

tenLayers.name: Acceptance
tenLayers.question: Does it satisfy the original need?

verificationDoctrine.law: You cannot skip layers. A system that passes integration tests but has no unit tests is a house built on sand.

modularityDoctrine.coreTruth: Every worthy system is composed of autonomous, self-contained units
modularityDoctrine.integrationLaw: Modules connect through defined contracts, not assumptions

threeAbsolutes.name: Decision-Support ONLY
threeAbsolutes.mandate: The system describes what signals show. It NEVER prescribes what the user should do.

threeAbsolutes.name: Never Resolve Contradictions
threeAbsolutes.mandate: When charts show opposing signals, EXPOSE the contradiction. NEVER determine which is 'correct'.

threeAbsolutes.name: Descriptive, Not Prescriptive
threeAbsolutes.mandate: Every output DESCRIBES signal states. No output PRESCRIBES action.
threeAbsolutes.enforcement: AI responses validated against prohibited patterns

lifecycleModules.entryExitGates: Each phase has ENTRY CRITERIA (must be GREEN before starting) and EXIT CRITERIA (must be GREEN before leaving)

fourPillars.enforcement: Contract tests validate implementation against schema
